articles.title: Can Fluffy BREAK Sean Strickland? | UFC Houston Preview
articles.description: Former middleweight champion Sean Strickland meets red-hot contender Anthony Hernandez in a pivotal UFC Houston clash that could decide who gets closest to a shot at Khamzat Chimaev, with Hernandez riding an eight-fight win streak built on relentless chain wrestling and brutal ground-and-pound against names like Roman Dolidze and Brendan Allen, while Strickland brings elite five-round experience, a suffocating jab, stabbing teep kicks, constant forward pressure, and proven durability from wins over Israel Adesanya and Paulo Costa, making this a classic pressure boxer vs grappling machine matchup where Hernandez must ground him consistently to win, but if Strickland controls range and stuffs the takedowns, his volume and composure likely carry him over 25 minutes. üîí Become a Member for special Perks, Exclusive Content and ultra-exclusive Live Chats: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrG2_1TcVkXKXXsD6Kjwig/join ü§ñ Join The Discord: https://discord.gg/fbb9pc59 ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Follow Michael on Social: https://www.instagram.com/mikebisping https://www.twitter.com/bisping https://www.facebook.com/mikethecountbisping ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Edited by John Brannigan: https://www.instagram.com/johnbranniganuk https://www.twitter.com/johnbranniganuk #bisping #ufc #mma #mixedmartialarts #michaelbisping #ufcnews #mmanews #ufchouston #seanstrickland #khamzatchimaev #anthonyhernandez

articles.title: 'Make Boxing GREAT AGAIN!?' Tyson Fury RETURNS! | Fury vs Makhmudov | BISPING REACTS
articles.description: 'MAKING BOXING GREAT AGAIN!?' Tyson Fury is officially back (again), returning at 37 years old to face Arslanbek Makhmudov at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, saying he‚Äôs coming back ‚Äúto make boxing great again‚Äù after retiring following two losses to Oleksandr Usyk; we break down Fury claiming he doesn‚Äôt need a training camp, the real reason this comeback happened following the tragic incident involving Anthony Joshua in Nigeria and Fury‚Äôs reminder that ‚Äútomorrow isn‚Äôt promised,‚Äù why the fight everyone truly wants is Fury vs Joshua next, John Fury losing the plot and clashing with Carl Froch, Islam Makhachev joking about sending AJ to Dagestan to learn wrestling, and whether this fifth comeback is serious or just another chapter in heavyweight boxing drama. üîí Become a Member for special Perks, Exclusive Content and ultra-exclusive Live Chats: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrG2_1TcVkXKXXsD6Kjwig/join ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Follow Michael on Social: https://www.instagram.com/mikebisping https://www.twitter.com/bisping https://www.facebook.com/mikethecountbisping ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Edited by John Brannigan: https://www.instagram.com/johnbranniganuk https://www.twitter.com/johnbranniganuk #bisping #boxing #netflixsports #netflix #tysonfury #anthonyjoshua #ufc #mma #islammakhachev

articles.title: Daniel Cormier & Ben Askren on White House fights, Tom Aspinall & UFC heavyweight PROBLEM, Jon Jones
articles.description: Ben Askren IS BACK with Daniel Cormier to talk all things UFC, MMA, and combat sports! Dana White and the UFC have apparently put together the White House fights, and DC and Ben break down who they think should fight on the legendary card. Plus, hear Askren's WILD THEORY on what the fight card should look like! DC and Askren also discuss Cain Velasquez's release from prison, Floyd Mayweather vs. Mike Tyson, as well as the problems with the UFC's heavyweight division and why it needs guys like Francis Ngannou, Ciryl Gane, and Tom Aspinall to be more active. And don't miss Ben cracking jokes about Jon Jones being on an Epstein email. All lines provided by @hardrockbet Follow me on all social media platforms!
